summary: The Department of Justice (DOJ) and the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) both enforce federal antitrust laws, which are meant to promote free and fair competition in the marketplace. We reviewed the types of antitrust cases each agency investigates, areas of overlap, and instances of conflict with respect to antitrust enforcement. We found that DOJ and FTC have an interagency clearance process to identify which agency...
title: Antitrust: DOJ and FTC Jurisdictions Overlap, but Conflicts are Infrequent
